meanings.sent1: The wimpish puppy hid behind its owner when it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: She always avoided confrontations, appearing wimpish to her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The wimpish squirrel was too scared to climb down from the tree.
meanings.sent4: His wimpish excuses for not participating in the game were getting old.
meanings.sent5: The wimpish knight trembled in fear at the sight of the dragon.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of strength or resolve; feeble.
meanings.sent1: The wimpish handshake left a poor impression during the job interview.
meanings.sent2: Her wimpish attempts at lifting the heavy box were unsuccessful.
meanings.sent3: The wimpish umbrella flipped inside out at the first gust of wind.
meanings.sent4: His wimpish argument crumbled under the weight of evidence presented.
meanings.sent5: The wimpish candle flickered weakly in the dark room.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a weak or ineffectual way.
meanings.sent1: His wimpish response to the challenge disappointed his friends.
meanings.sent2: She felt wimpish for not standing up for herself in the situation.
meanings.sent3: The wimpish attempt to fix the leak only made it worse.
meanings.sent4: The wimpish apology lacked sincerity and conviction.
meanings.sent5: The wimpish leader failed to inspire confidence in the team.
